description: This is the entrance hall to the thieves' and assassins' guild.  It is
a place where the unwary can lose both their life and their money if they
are not careful.  To the south is the Street of Death and there is a hatch
in the floor leading to the thieves' bar.
3027.name: Entrance to the Guild of Thieves

description: You see the Street.

2871.name: Below The Ruins of the Pawn Shop

description: Arsenal street runs north and south beside the western wall of
Westbrige.  There are several nondescript buildings lining the
street but none of them allow entry from here.
3130.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  A small
river flows through an arch in the wall far below and disappears
into the forest beyond.  The wall extends to the south.  To the
north is an archway leading to the eastern gatehouse.
2924.name: Atop the western wall

description: It is a rather large fireplace made from heavy granite rocks.
The wooden sign says :-
Use 'list' to see what is in store,
'buy <item>' to buy an item,
'sell <item>' to sell an item and
'value <item>' to make the leather worker evaluate an item.
It is made from solid oak but appears to be very used.  Its surface is
covered in marks and scratches.  A large burning candle stands directly on
the table surface, tallow flowing down its sides.
A lush tall green plant is here, growing in the sunshine.
An acrid smell fills this large room.  Along the walls are numerous
shelves containing all sorts of animal hide and in the crackling fireplace
hangs a big iron pot with boiling water.  In the middle of the room is a
large oak table.
A wooden sign is hanging above the fireplace.
3035.name: Acid's Leather {!& Head{0 Shop

description: You see the Street.
The secret underground practice yard of thieves and assassins.  To the west
is the bar.  An open well leads down into darkness where a rotten stench wafts
up.
3029.name: Secret Yard

description: You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
You are on Park Road which leads south and north.  Elm Street is east of
here.
3122.name: Park Road

description: Penny Lane dead ends here in a small, circular cul-de-sac.  There
is a large fountain in the middle of the circle.  A variety of quaint
little houses line the secluded street.
3141.name: End of Penny Lane

description: This is the foyer of a large cathedral.  It feels as if two opposing
spiritual forces are at work in this space; one pulling to the north,
and one pulling to the south.
3362.name: Church foyer

description: You see a darkness trying to pull you in.
A holy light is drawing toward you.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
There are several ghostly-white beings relaxing in this crypt-like
underground bar.  Seated in line along the bar are several obviously
living people, each bearing several bite-marks.  It is a mystery
whether they are food or just tomorrow's vampires.  A small sign
hangs on the wall.
3375.name: Vampire's Bar

description: You see the crypt.
Two massive iron gates rise above the ground here, surrounded by a
foot thick stone wall.  A large stone arch rises above the iron gates,
with "Westbridge" carved on either side.  The gates and surrounding
stone wall was built by the Tripower after the Great Vectorian
Invasion, in which the towns people of Westbridge fought against the
Vectorian Nation, destroying its army at these very walls.  Beyond the
walls the city street ends, and the Northern Plains begin.  The gates
lead to other areas like The Elven Valley, Mount Olympus, Makou City,
and the Ruins of Ofcol.
3076.name: The Northern Gates Of Westbridge

description: A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the east, the beginning
of a mountain range blocks the view.  To the south, beyond the dark
canopy of the Miden'nir forest, the mountain range curves toward the
west.  Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
2928.name: Top of the southeast tower

description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  The top
of a strange tower is just visible above the forest east of here.
To the north, an archway leads into one of the city watchtowers.
To the south is the top of the eastern gatehouse.
2915.name: Atop the eastern wall

description: The Street of Death continues east and west between many different
buildings.  South of here is {RDick's Warehouse Of New & Used Boats{x.
North is the {CRangers Guild{x.  The street leads west toward Main Street
and east toward Coffin Street.
3045.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 608 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 609 Street Of Death, Westbridge
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  Looks pretty solid.
The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
3200.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: You see the river flowing west into the Forest of Haon-Dor.
This is a western section of the Street of Life.  It seems the road
has recently been repaved with some new stone work having been laid
down.  The road stretches on to the east and west.
3301.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
WOW you can fly!  You are floating in the air above Temple Square of Westbridge.
3057.name: In the air

description: More of the same.
Back down on the earth where you should be!
Coffin Street continues through eastern Westbridge.  To the west
is a vacant lot covered in grass and a few medium sized trees.  To
the east is a large building belonging to Judge Incorporated.  The
street continues north and south.
2828.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
{GA{gn old courtyard is here, just off of the Pax Lounge.  The stones,
of what appear to be ancient rocks, are almost completely covered in
moss, which seems to softly glow green.  The grass in this courtyard
does not appear to grow any taller than the mere inches that it is
already.  It is cool with dew, all day, as if it was magical.  The air
in this courtyard is perfect, crisp and cool, and smelling of flowers
and moss.  The blessings of {YCe{yl{wes{yt{Yia{g is upon this place.  {x
2866.name: {GMos{gs cov{wered Co{gurty{Gard{x

description: Here is a bend in Emerald Avenue.  The road continues to the
east and south.  To the south, Emerald Avenue ends at South
Street in the shadow of the southern wall of Westbridge.
3121.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: This chair is really a masterpiece.  A chair where one can sit as comfortably
as in a bed.  All lecture halls should be equipped with these things.
You are in the not very big office of the once great Mayor Drott of Westbridge.
A large burnt and completely destoryed desk is standing in front of an evenly
burnt armchair that looks so uncomfortable that Satan himself would not sit in
it. The walls are black and you see a bed made out of old junk. The story is the
town hall caught fire during the great hall, and Mayor Drott went crazy. After the
re-election he still wandered the street thinking he was mayor.
3138.name: Mayor's Office

description: The waiting room is to the west.

2877.name: The Southern End Of The Wreckage

description: | {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|
|               {wbut only if the shopkeeper deals in      {b|
|               {wthat kind of item.                       {b|
| {GVALUE {g<{citem{g> {g- {wthe shopkeeper will offer you a price   {b|
|                {wfor your item, if he is interested at   {b|
|                {wall.                                    {b|
| {YHELPFUL BUYING TIP:                                    {b|
| {WHaving problems selling an item? Try selling it in a   {b|
| {Wshop that specializes in the type of item. For example,{b|
| {Wsell a sword to an armorer or weaponsmith, or find a   {b|
| {Wpawn shop, which will buy just about anything!         {b|
The armoury with all kinds of armours on the walls and in the window.
There are helmets, shields and chain mails.  To the north is Westbridge
Way.  On the wall is a small sign.
3020.name: Armoury

description: The walls are made of bricks: solid, cold and dry.  A window barred
with iron looks out to the east over the lawlessness of the dangerous
neighborhood beyond.  A small cot chained to the southern wall provides
a place to sit, otherwise there is little of interest in this room.
From the holding cell prisoners are sent to the local jail, and from
the jail they are sent to the prison.
3085.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{colding {CC{cell{*]{x

description: A large room opens up to reveal a medium size table in the center.
Against the northern wall are cabinets surrounding a makou gas stove.
Next to the stove stands an iron ice box.  The surrounding walls have
random papers tacked to them, a few newspaper articles, and even a few
comical drawings.  A window to the east overlooks the gangland beyond.
3091.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{cess {CH{call{*]{x

description: The street continues running north and south through the southwest
section of westbridge.  To the west are the recently constructed
neighborhoods of Westbridge.  To the south, Judge Street intersects
with Arsenal.
2845.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
South Street continues alongside the southern wall of Westbridge.
The buildings here look distinctly more run-down than other areas
of the city, and it just gets worse to the east.  To the north is
a vacant lot littered with trash.
2834.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see South Street, Westbridge.
The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
3204.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: This small room is built directly into the city wall.  There is a
mechanism for lowering the siege door for the east gate built into
the wall.  Unfortunately, the mechanism seems to be rust locked
from years of neglect.  A staircase leads up to the top of the
gatehouse.  Coffin Street is to the west.
2905.name: Eastern gatehouse

description: This small, dimly lit tunnel runs under Main Street and the
Temple of Life.  A bright light can be seen coming from the
north and the thick cement foundation of the Temple of Life
looms overhead.
3262.name: Tunnel Under the Temple of Life

description: You see the Outside of Westbridge.
You see Street of Life.
Alongside the western wall of the city, Arsenal Street runs
north and south, marking the western edge of Westbridge.  To
the east is the turbulent {YTemple of Talos{x.
2887.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.
2916.name: Eastern gatehouse

description: | {WFrom level 1-15 when you die, your corpse and fist will {b|
| {Wend up in this Morgue. After level 15, your corpse and  {b|
| {Wfist will lie in the place you died (see HELP DEATH for {b|
| {Wmore information).                                      {b|
The morgue is clean, wet, and dimly lit.  This is the place good
and neutral aligned people go when they die.  Evil ones go to hell.
A small healing pool sits in the middle of the room.  Rows of people,
both dead and alive, are lined against the wall.  A healer stands in
the middle of the room chanting healing spells.  A sign hangs here.
3054.name: City Morgue

description: A brickwork arch marks stairs going down into a large building
below.  Sounds of work can be heard as steam and smoke rises from
various holes and smokestacks.
3072.name: Gateway to the Mob Factory

description: This is Westbridge Way, passing east and west through the City of
Westbridge.  North of here is the entrance to the {RBakery{x.  Just to
the east is the bustling Market Square, the hub of all activity in
Westbridge.
3013.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 504 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
The walls of Westbridge reach high overhead to the east, helping to
keep the city safe from its enemies... hopefully.  {RNisstyre's Tavern{x,
the famous sailor's dive, is west.  A bridge over the Westbridge river
lies north.  Beyond the bridge, Coffin Street continues into the northern
part of Westbridge.
3070.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 306 Coffin Street, Westbridge
You are walking down the Concoruse, along the western wall of Westbridge.  To
the north, the road passes by a beautiful park, to the south, you can see
the southwest corner of the city wall.
3271.name: On the Concourse near the park

description: The concourse heads north, passing by a beautiful park.
You can see the southwest corner of the city wall.
Here is the second story of the Market Square Pub.  A large
balcony in the corner overlooks Market Square.  A few tables
are located on the balcony, allowing a view of the people of
Market Square.  Downstairs is the main bar.
2851.name: Second Story of the Pub

description: The entrance hall is a small, poor lighted room.  A narrow flight
of stairs leads down into the bar, where pipe smoke fills the air.
3017.name: Entrance to Mage's Guild

description: The practice yard of the fighters.  To the north is the bar.  A well leads
down into darkness.
3023.name: Tournament and Practice Yard

description: You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.
A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub.  Mugs line a shelf
behind the bar.  Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids decorate one
of the lower shelves.  A large cask rests on a table behind the bar.  A
strong but friendly-looking bartender stands next to the cask polishing
glasses.  A couple of the bar maids stand in a corner and throw the most
inviting glances your way. An open balcony looks out over the bustling
Market Square.
3357.name: [E] Bar

description: You are walking around the scenic concourse as it continues its path around
the city of Westbridge.  The south gate of the city lies to your east, and the
southwestern corner of the city wall is west.  Emerald Avenue stretches out
to the north.
3128.name: On the Concourse

description: You can see the heavily guarded southern gate of Westbridge.
This crypt is filled wall-to-wall with coffins, some open, some tossed
haphazardly against the wall, some perfectly undisturbed.  It's so dark
here even elves would have trouble seeing clearly.  A well in the middle
of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the depths.
3376.name: Vampire's Crypt

description: You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the east the
plains stretch out in the distance. To the north a small dusty trail follow
the city wall.
3053.name: Outside East Gate of Westbridge

description: The trail continues around the City of Westbridge.
You see the plains.
You see the city gate.
To the east was once the X-Cops Police Station but that is now
long gone.  Now it is a large warehouse type building, owned by
Judge Incorporated, used for the storage and construction of
airships.  Coffin Street continues to the north and to the south
where it intersects with Judge Street.
2829.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 317 Coffin Street, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.
The bar of the thieves.  Once upon a time this place was beautifully
furnished, but now it seems almost empty.  It begs the question if the
furniture may have been stolen.  To the east is the yard, and up a
ladder is the entrance hall.
3028.name: {BThieves' Bar{x

description: Arsenal Street runs alongside the recently developed neighborhoods
of Westbridge.  Many large trees grow beside the road, along with well
manicured bushes and trimmed grass.  The street leads north and south.
2843.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
Here is a beautiful square.  This is where the politicians come to talk
about, well, politics.  The ground is paved with small cut marble.  In
the center of the square is a large gazebo.  Benches line the sides of
the square.  There is a round hole with a lid on it, leading to somewhere
unknown. To the south is a beautiful bridge and the Park in the distance
beyond.
3030.name: {CCr{cier {CSq{cuare{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see the sewers.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
The bar is one of the wierdest in the land.  Mystical images float around
the air.  Illusions of fine furniture appear all around the room.
3018.name: Mage's Bar

description: You see the laboratory.
Your face is reflected in its surface.
| {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|

| {Wis 1 gold and 100 gold is 1 platinum (see HELP MONEY   {b|
| {Wfor more information.                                  {b|
They are made from polished gold and looks as if they are securely fastened
to the smooth stone walls.
Here is a small, beautifully furnished room.  The warm light emanating
from the small oil lamps on the walls is reflected in the hard, polished
surface of the big mahogany desk that stands in the center of the room.
A small sign sits on the desk.
3034.name: Bob's Jeweller Super Shop

description: Splash!  This is the middle of the duck pond in the park.  Swans
can normally be found gliding about on the still water.  Dry land
is available to the west, south, or east.
3114.name: Pond

description: River Street continues east and west as the sounds of Southern
Westbridge bustle from the many shops and patrons.  Here, the river can
be heard lapping at the pilings of the dock by {RKate's Diner{x to the north.
Emerald Avenue leads off to the south.
3103.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 706 Ocean Street, Westbridge
South Street runs here between the southern wall to the south and
the side of the Cityguard Headquarters to the north.  To the east is
Main Street and the south gate of the city.
2837.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge
The busy pub is filled with patrons.  People are laughing and
singing.  A minstrel plays his lute in another part of the pub, and a
few people are even dancing.  Andy, the pubs owner, wanders around and
checks to see that the needs of his customers are met.  The bar is to
your north.  East of you is another section of the pub.  You know that
there are rooms to be had somewhere around here...
3355.name: Andy's Pub

description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Not much
can be seen from here since mountains block the view to the east.
The wall extends to the north.  To the south, an archway leads
into one of the city watchtowers.
2919.name: Atop the eastern wall

description: This well-traveled road the Main Street of Westbridge.  Gas lamp
lights line the side of the street on either side.  South of here is
the {RMarket Square{x.
3107.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
To the east are small towers that have been built into the city
wall and are connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden
gate.  Westbridge Way leads west from here.  Coffin Street inter-
sects the street, heading north and south along the city wall.
3041.name: Inside the East Gate of Westbridge

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see the city gate.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.
A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub.  Mugs line a
shelf behind the bar.  Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids
decorate one of the lower shelves.  A large cask rests on a table
behind the bar.  A strong but friendly looking bartender stands next
to the cask polishing glasses.  A couple of the bar maids stand in a
corner and throw the most inviting glances your way.  At the corner of
the bar is a small hatch leading down into a shop on the lower level.
You can watch the patrons enter and exit the shop from this place in
secret.
3358.name: [W] Bar

description: This is the western end of the Street of Death, just before it hits
Arsenal Street.  Further east can be found entrances to several shops
and the ever-popular Casino Nights.
2811.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the north the road goes on and to the
east is the Road Crossing.  To the south, the ancient cliffs rise from deep
under the ground, forming a wall. You see the Temple of Shar to the north.
3135.name: Park Road

description: Coffin street runs north and south through Westbridge.  A few
wild flowers grow along the western side of the street.  To the
east is the northern end of what used to be the X-Cops Building
but is now a warehouse for Judge Incorporated.
2827.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You are on River Street.  To the south, on the other side of a low
fence, is the park and all its lush, green vegetation.  To the north,
the river of Westbridge flows east and west alongside River Street.
2824.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenel Street, Westbridge.
You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and south along the wall.
3389.name: West trail around Westbridge

description: South Street leads east along the southern wall of the city.  Here
it intersects with what used to be the western most street in the city,
Arsenal Street, which runs northward alongside the neighborhoods of
Westbridge.  Cavern Road leads to the west into the southern housing
area.  To the south is the base of the southwest guard tower.
2840.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge.
This large room, filled with the chatter of Paxians, radiates with
an aura of power.  This is the resting place of the Guardians of
Westbridge.  Upon the walls hang the banners of the clans of the Pax
Faerunis Alliance.  They hang proudly, side by side, on display for
the world to see.  Scattered around the room are several couches, as
well as some tables and chairs.  And stretched along one wall is a bar,
serving drinks to the Paxians.  To the west, a cool breeze wafts in
from the courtyard.
2867.name: {xThe {YP{Wa{YX{x Lounge

description: You stand atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the north, a wall of
mountains rise up out of the plains.  To the west, the green canopy of
the Haon Dor forest extends as far as the eye can see.
Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
2926.name: Top of the northwest tower

description: This is the well known Festival Square.  Many people pass by as they
enjoy all the sights of Westbridge.  The Street of Death crosses west
and east.  A short ways to the north is Market Square and to the south
is Crier Square.  Festival Square and Crier Square are actually locked
together, the bricks interlocked together to form one large square.
Park benches line the sides of this square.  Further to the west can
be seen a large brick building, with a sign that reads "Casino Nights".
The road going east and west seems a bit narrow and dark.
3025.name: {CFe{cstival Squa{Cre{x

description: You see the Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see the Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
This is a walkway atop the western wall of Westbridge.  A forest
extends to the west, and a small castle is barely visible above the
treetops.  To the north, an archway leads into one of the city
watchtowers.  To the south is the top of the western gatehouse.
2911.name: Atop the western wall

description: This room has a feral smell to it, as if it were once a stable
of some sort.  A rack of spears of various lengths and designs
adorns the western wall.  An exit leads south to the street.  A
small trapdoor is set into the floor.
3371.name: Entrance to Ranger's Guild

description: This section of Coffin Street is just north of the East Gate of the
city.   Further north, the street eventually leads to the Westbridge
Train Station.  To the east is the Eastern Gatehouse.
3267.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 303 Coffin Street, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.
Here, just east of Festival Square, runs the Street Of Death.  To the
south is the {CThieves Guild{x.  The sounds of a variety of animals can be
heard coming from the {RPet Shop{x to the north.  The street continues
west and east.
3026.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 606 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 607 Street Of Death, Westbridge
This area is the greener side of Westbridge--better known as the
park walk, which includes the city park, surrounding shops, apartments,
and cafes.  A quaint little cafe sits on the north side of the street
with a sign that reads {RPark Cafe{x.  Judge Street continues through to
the west and further to the City Plaza to the east.
2857.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: This is the roof of the Market Square Cafe.  To the east, Market
Square sits almost directly below.  All around, there is an excellent
view of the different buildings and the skyline of the city.  Several
small round tables are available, providing customers a place to enjoy
their coffee.
2850.name: Roof Of The Cafe

description: You walk into a small building, and a small lobby.  In the center
of the lobby you see a small desk with a secretary sitting behind it.
To the south, you see a large sign that says "WESTBRIDGE CITY MORGUE".
A staircase leads upwards to the "NEWBIE SCHOOL".  Back north is the
city.
3261.name: The Westbridge Newbie School

description: This is Main Street in Westbridge.  On the western side of the street,
lush grass, green bushes, and large trees can be found in the Park of
Westbridge.  Main Street continues north and south.
3105.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 108 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
Each scroll is stored in a leather tube that protects it from moist.
Most of them appear to be very old and dusty.
Some of them are transparent enabling you to see that some contain colored
powders while others contain body parts of various animals.
This is a small room that smells of rare chemicals and substances.
A large desk divides the room in two and on the wall behind it are
numerous shelves crammed with jars, bottles, books and scrolls of all
sorts and sizes.
3033.name: Tim the Enchanter's Magic Shop

description: You see Westbridge Way.
A fresh built street leads off north towards the northern wall of
Westbridge.  To the south stands the Temple of Life, the meeting
place for the newly born, or freshly killed.  South of the Temple
is the city of Westbridge, filled with many shops, pubs and good
food.  The Healing Wound Inn is also south, which is a popular
healing place for Westbridge.  To the west sits the smoldering ruins
of a bar that seems to have been smited by the gods.  To the north
stands the Northern Gates of Westbridge.
3078.name: {CMai{cn Str{&eet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: A plain door opens up to a small but well-kept office.  A few cubicles
are in the office and secretaries can be heard chatting behind the walls.
A large counter is on the far wall of the office with a man standing behind
it.  Boxes, papers, and the like are strewn about the counter, awaiting
transport to parts unknown.
3066.name: The Westbridge Courier

description: The strong stone walls of Westbridge rise up to the west, keeping evil at bay.
The concourse heads towards a bridge to the north, and continues south
alongside a beautiful park.
3270.name: On the Concourse

description: The concourse heads south, passing by a beautiful park.
The air grows chill as you pass near the Elm Street graveyard.  The walls of
Westbridge are to the east, and the concourse continues to the north and south.
To your west, you see Elm Street at the graveyard entrance.
3273.name: On the Concourse at Elm Street

description: The concourse continues to the north, towards an intersection with Penny Lane.
You see Elm Street and the graveyard entrance.
This is a small circular room at the base of the southwest guard
tower.  Spiral stairs lead further up into the watchtower.  To the
north is the intersection of South and Arsenal.
2902.name: Base of the southwest tower

description: Main Street and Judge Street meet to form Westbridge City Plaza.
This newer area has been converted from what was once an extension
of the park of Westbridge.  City Plaza is a large square.  In the
center, a fountain pours forth clean, cool water.  Some park benches
sit on the side of the plaza.  Main Street continues north and south.
Judge Street goes east and west.
2817.name: {W[ {CWe{cstbridge {RC{rity {GP{glaza {W]{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You find a table that's relatively vomit-free.
Bare, except for the holes.
This is a small, dank establishment.  There is a large bar with a row
of drunken men sitting along it.  The walls are bare because patrons
either steal, or beat each other in the head, with whatever they can
get their hands on.  A booth sits to the north.
3352.name: Nisstyre's Tavern

description: Coffin Street continues north and south along the eastern city wall.
To the east, in the shadow of the towering wall, is the very courtroom-
like {YTemple of Tyr{x.
3061.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
Arsenal Street, running north and south along the western wall,
meets with the Street of Death, leading off to the east.  To the
west are the imposing columns of the Temple of Fear.  Some letters
have been written on the wall here.
3043.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: The fresh young leaves of the elm tree wave gently in the wind.
You near the end of Elm Street.  An old elm tree grows here.
The concourse joins Elm Street to the east, and the
street ends to the north near a run-down neighborhood.
3124.name: Elm Street

description: You see the concourse.
This is Park Road, a small little lane which leads north and south,
connecting the park and Judg Street.  Ducks, birds and small animals
can often be seen frolicking about on the lush green grass.  A quaint
little cafe is accessible to the east.
3118.name: Park Road

description: The walls of Westbridge tower high to the east, helping to keep the
city safe from its enemies... hopefully.  An intersection with a dark
Street lies north, and a bridge over the Westbridge river is south.
Beyond the bridge Coffin Street continues into the southern part of
Westbridge.
3252.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
This entire world has been integrated, modified, debugged, and enhanced by
Hatchet, Kahn, and Furey of MERC Industries to be run by any MERC Mud.
1992 December 17
Westbridge ReArrangment By NissLifee, 1997 September 14
ROM enhancements by Alander.
ROT enhancements by Vengeance.
This is the interior of a large white marble temple.  A pipe organ
plays in the background as people sing a hymn of peacefulness.  A
priest up front tells the story of the forces of the realms, be it Life,
the force that gives breath and a heartbeat, and Death, the force that
steals these gifts away.  There is a guard standing watch, keeping the
peace.  To the south is the Temple Square and to the west is the donation
room.  To the east is the {RCity Morgue{x and a newer section of Main Street
heads off to the north.
3001.name: The Temple of Life

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 100 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
This is a small room built into the city wall.  A mechanism for
lowering the siege door for the west gate is set into the wall, but
seems to be rust locked from years of neglect.  A small staircase
leads up to the top of the gatehouse.  Arsenal Street is to the east.
2908.name: Western gatehouse

description: This hidden grotto is Nemesis' private chamber.  One must be careful
not to let her catch them here, or they may never want to leave.  Leather
straps hang down from the walls, some of which are still occupied.
There is a huge canopied waterbed with mirrors set into the ceiling
overhead.  The bed has black satin sheets and five or six huge feather
pillows.  Leather restraints fall down off the four corners of the bed.
3379.name: Nemesis' Private Dungeon

description: You see the House of Fetish.
Judge Street ends here at Arsenal Street beside the neighborhoods
of Westbridge.  Judge leads off to the east, heading toward a cafe
and Westbridge City Plaza beyond.  The park lies to the north along
Arsenal Street, which also continues to the south.
2844.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
A wide boat ramp leads up to {RDick's Warehouse of Boats{x where all
variety of raft and canoe are sold.  To the south, the gentle waters
of the Westbridge River lap against the ramp.
3073.name: Below Dick's Warehose Of Boats

description: This is the western section of Westbridge Way.  To the south of
here is the entrance to the {RArmoury{x.  The street continues east
toward Market Square.  The {RMagic Shop{x is to the north and a little
ways west is the city gate.
3012.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 502 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
Here, the road leads between two small towers that have been built
into the city wall, connected with a footbridge across the heavy
wooden gate.  Westbridge Way leads east all the way through the town.
To the west, the edge of a big forest can be seen.
2893.name: Under the West Gate of Westbridge

description: At the base of the tower is this small circular room.  Spiral stairs
lead further up into the watchtower.  A recently renovated entranceway
in the north wall leads to {RThe Westbridge Train Station{x.  What looks
to have once been a doorway in the south wall has been bricked shut.
2906.name: Base of the Northeast Tower

description: The sign on the door says:-
Cityguard Head Quarters
The road continues north and south.  A building is just west of here, you
notice a sign on the door.  The park entrance is to the east.
3111.name: Park Road

description: Emerald Avenue continues north and south.  It is a somewhat narrow
street that sees less traffic than other parts of Westbridge.  To the
west is the {YTemple of Oghma{x.
3117.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: This is the eastern end of the Street Of Death just before it ends into
Coffin Street.  The tall eastern wall of Westbridge can be seen in the
distance beyond Coffin Street.  There is a nondescript {Rwarehouse{x to
the south.  The {RFountain Of Youth Apothecary{x is north
3046.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 610 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 611 Street Of Death, Westbridge
This is the small dark room in which the Pet Shop Boy keeps his pets.
It is vital that this room be immediately after the pet shop.
3032.name: Pet Shop Store

description: This is the beginning of western Judge Street, just west of the City
Plaza.  North is a vacant lot, closed off from access to the street.
To the south is the side of the newly built city hall, bright and clean
with a modern twist to a traditional look in Westbridge.  Just east of
here is Westbridge City Plaza.
2856.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: River Street follows the river, which runs through Westbridge just
north of here.  The cool bubbling waters sound from between the
buildings.  To the south is a bright area in the park.  To the north
sits the {RStables of Westbridge{x, while River Street continues west into
the neighborhoods of the city.
3101.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 704 Ocean Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
A small hallway runs north and south inside the OOJ Westbridge
Station.  The hall stretches north from here, ending to the south.
The southern wall is covered in small pictures of past residence of
this station house.  A door to the east is marked Locker Room, and a
door to the west is marked Sleeping Quarters.
3088.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{callway{*]{x

description: Your eyes open and the pain of your last battle hits you. You have been killed
and now are resting in a plane not of that of the area surrounding Westbridge.
You are in an underground cave that is lighted by lava and brimstone. The
smell of sulfur is strong. You see in the distances mortals chained together
dragging a bolder across the hot floor. A human with hoofed feet and a tail
and a whip attacks the slaves dragging the boulder.
3366.name: In A Place Of Lava

description: You see the southern end of the temple of Death.
This small room is built directly into the city wall.  There is a
mechanism for lowering the siege door for the east gate built into
the wall.  Unfortunately, the mechanism seems to be rust locked
from years of neglect.  A staircase leads up to the top of the
gatehouse.  Coffin Street is to the west.
2904.name: Eastern Gatehouse

description: This open building is filled with racks of rafts and canoes all stacked
on top of each other.  There is an exit to the street to the north.  There
is a wide boat ramp leading down toward the river.  Across the river can
be seen a small boat landing built off of Kate's Diner.
3049.name: Dick's Warehouse of Boats

description: You see the Street.
The high wall bordering the south side of Westbridge casts its
shadow over South Street.  This area is often frequented by bums
and is notorious for pickpockets.  The {YTemple of Chauntea {xsits to
the south.  It resembles a greenhouse and seems out of place in the
dilapidated surroundings.
2835.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see South Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge.
You find yourself on Judge Street just east of Main.  To the south
is the brightly lit Westbridge Quick-Mart, to the west is the Westbridge
City Plaza, and to the east is the intersection with Emerald Avenue.
2853.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: Emerald Avenue makes a bend as it meanders through a series of
alleys between the various shops and temples on the south end of
the city.  Tall buildings line either side of the street.
3134.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: This is the western end of the Westbridge park.  A small, tree
lined path winds its way lazily around the park and west, out onto
Arsenal Street.  To the east is the edge of a small pond.
3112.name: Western Park Entrance

description: This is the Street Of Death, just west of Main Street.  Melancholy's
map shop is to the north.  The street continues further west and east,
where Festival Square can be found.
3024.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 604 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
This is a tidy office within the Cityguard Headquarters.  A big
desk made from dark wood is standing in the centre of the room.
Cityguards come and go with regularity.
3110.name: Cityguard Headquarters

description: You see a sign saying 'KEEP OUT'.
The puddles on the floor are filthy and exude a foul stench.
| {WThis is one of many pawnshops that operates throughout   {b|
| {Wthe realms. Pawnshops will buy nearly any item, and      {b|
| {Ware a great place to find useful items that other people {b|
| {Whave sold. This pawnshop will only hold 100 items--any   {b|
| {Wbeyond that will not appear in the list.                 {b|
This is a very cluttered shop. All kinds of armor, weapons, clothing,
and gems line the walls.  It is so cluttered it seems as if one thing
is moved the whole mess may come crashing down. There is a nice man
sitting behind a counter, counting his gold pieces.  A small trapdoor
in the floor is almost hidden by the merchandise.
3170.name: Westbridge Pawn Shop

description: This entire world has been integrated, modified, debugged, and enhanced by
Hatchet, Kahn, and Furey of MERC Industries to be run by any MERC Mud.
1992 December 17
ROM enhancements by Alander.
ROT enhancements by Vengeance.
You stand in a large black marble temple.  You hear strange music
coming from the altar, it sounds like a guitar but..  Almost
electrical.  Some Demons stand on the altar yelling out strange
chants.  You hear the priest up front tell the story of the forces of
the realms, being it Life, the force that gives you breath, a
heartbeat.  And Death, the force that steals these gifts away.  You
see a guard here keeping the peace.  To the south is the Temple
Square.  And to the west is the donation room.  To the east is the
{RCity Morgue{x and to the north is the {CWaterdeep Gardens{x.
3365.name: Temple Of Death

description: You see a small donation room.
You see the temple square.
{x
{cStone walls are covered in {Cweapon racks and suits {cof armor.  Tapestries
{cdepicting various scenes {Cof battle add vivacious{c sparks of color. Grand
{cchandeliers hang  by th{Cick ropes from high  ce{cilings and cast a dancing
{cglow  of light  over {Ceverything.  Between ra{ccks of  sturdy weapons  and
{cwoven tapestries,  {Ctall windows open  to t{che Waterdeep Gardens,  giving
{cview to the  well{C-tended treasure  withi{cn. A wide set of  stairs in the
{cmiddle of the r{Coom leads downward to t{che city of Westbridge.{x
3077.name: {CR{coom {Co{cf {CW{car{x

description: A walkway leads atop the southern wall of Westbridge.  Down below,
the great plains extend far to the north and a mountain range is just
visible.  Archways to the east and west lead into city watchtowers.
2913.name: Atop the northern wall

description: The street continues north and south near the eastern wall of Westbridge.
To the east, the wall presses in close.  On the opposite side of the street
are several buildings, none of which open onto the street.
2891.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: This is Wetbridge Way, the main route east and west through town.  To the
north is the {RGeneral Store{x.  To the west, the busy sounds of Market Square
can he heard.  {BWestbridge Way{x <{RR{W4{*2{W0{x> continues east and west.
3015.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 506 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
Coffin Street continues north and south.  To the east is a run down
neighborhood separated from this part of Westbridge by a large wall.
To the west, there are several structures characteristic of the
southern part of the city: temples, taverns, and some residential
apartment buildings futher on the western side.
2833.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: A small bar has been built under Crier Square, for the airship
pilots to sit and relax in.  Within a small and quiet bar stands, with
nice paintings on the wall and mainly clean.  Phil the bartender is
behind his bar cleaning glasses, and a few fellow pilots sit at the
bar.  A large jukebox sits to one corner, and a pool table with a
light in the other.
3036.name: {YP{*hil's {RB{rar{x

description: This is Arsenal Street, which runs north and south through
Westbridge.  To the east is the entrance to Westbrigde Park.
It is a relaxing spot of natural beauty in the midst of all
the surrounding buildings.
2847.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
Coffin Street widens here to a small open area where several people
can be seen loitering.  To the west is a dark, hole in the wall place
with a hanging sign above the entrance.  The sign reads simply the
{RPIT{x, and is on the verge of falling over.  This seems like a bad
part of town.
2832.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: This small patch of grass is set a small distance away from the
main path through the park.  It is surrounded by flowering bushes
and small butterflies flutter from blossom to blossom.  In this
place, the troubles of everyday life in the city seem miles away.
3082.name: A Quiet Corner in the Park

description: A small room opens up here.  A large counter stretches across the
room leaving very little room to stand in.  Behind the counter are
several rows of shelves, with large crates on top.  A few workers walk
back and forth with clipboards checking the stock, as a very fat guy
sits at the counter looking not so busy.
3063.name: Westbridge Beacon Courier

description: This is the holy sanctum.  A wizened old woman occupies this room,
chanting very softly to herself.  On a table in the corner is a large
tome, and the walls are covered with creeper vines and flowers.  A well
in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft
from the depths.
3370.name: Druid's Holy Sanctum

description: You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
This large, open area is the Westbridge Courier Office's parking lot.
The ground is coated with oil stains and a few broken-down airships sit
in corners of the lot, dragged away and awaiting towing.  A small
building is in the eastern part of the lot, a set of stairs leading up
into it.  A sign on the building reads, "{RWestbridge Courier{x"
3065.name: Airship Parking

description: Here, along the southern wall of Westbridge, South Street runs east
and west.  This is a nicer area of the city, close to the private
neighborhoods.  To the west is the intersection with Arsenal Street.
2839.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see South Street, Westbridge
You see Arsenel Street, Westbridge
{Y<<<{RImmortals Only{Y>>>{x
{x
This room is here to hold mobs and items essential for the correct
operation of the Crypt of Despair.  Do not purge any mobs or objects
you may find in this room, or load any additional mobs or objects into
this room.  Thank you.
3300.name: {YC{yrypt {*of {RD{respair {xSecondary Holding Room

description: {B
| {WTo convert platinum to gold, or gold to silver, drop   {b|
| {Wone more piece than what you have.                     {b|
| {GExample{g: {wyou have 5 platinum, 8 gold, and need more    {b|
| {wgold to change your alignment. Simply drop 9 gold on   {b|
| {wthe ground, and you will then have 99 gold--enough for {b|
| {wthe priest's services!                                 {b|
Made of pure gold, the altar shines with an unearthly beauty.
Ancient runes cover it's surface.
Life's benevolence can be felt upon entering this small chapel
dedicated to the force of Life.  The church of Life is widely known
for helping those in good favor, and those who wish to be... for a
price.  A golden altar occupies the center of the room.
3360.name: In Life's Chapel

description: You see a small foyer.
A tunnel large enough for an airship turns east to a pair of large
doors, on the doors written into the wood is "WESTBRIDGE CARGO
COURIER, Blow Horn For Entrance".
3094.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x

description: A free flowing river of water flows here directly underneath Westbridge!
It's currents are much to fast to go swimming in, but along the side a small
pool of water has developed.  The water is crystal clear and taps directly
into the the whole water system of Westbridge.
3394.name: Westbridge's Water Source

description: Hmm...some of the bars have been ripped out of the wall.  Enough to pass a
good sized raft or canoe, or perhaps even a barge.  You wonder what sort of
beast had the strength to do this.
A strong stone bridge spans the Westbridge River.  Below, the river
flows into an opening in the city wall that is sealed with strong metal
bars.  The bridge allows Coffin Street to continue along the length of
the city north and south of here.
3253.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet {CB{cr{&id{cg{Ce{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
When the door to the shop is opened, sudden gusts of wind often
enter the shop, sending scraps of paper flying around the room.
This room is cluttered with old pieces of parchment, stacks of books,
and odd scraps.  A desk with slightly less clutter than the rest of
the shop is near the back wall.  A scroll case full of scrolls is
behind the desk.  A bookcase sits to the right and to the left is a
window overlooking a small garden.  A small door, half hidden by a
stack of books, leads to a room in the back of the shop.
3160.name: Melancholy's Maps

description: A sign on the door says, "Unauthorized Personel Prohibited".
To the south is the Westbridge Way.  Across the Street, you see the Grubby Inn.
This is a dim and narrow entrance hall for the House of Fetish.  There's
not much to see, just a man in a three piece suit checking ID's and waving
people through.
3377.name: Entrance to the House of Fetish

description: You see the House of Fetish.
The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
3203.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: Arsenal street runs north and south beside the western wall of
Westbrige.  There are several nondescript buildings lining the
street but none of them allow entry from here.  The street meets
the Street of Death just to the south.
2886.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: This is a dimly lit neighborhood pub.  The walls are brick and
adorned with different pictures.  The pub is very gently lit and
cigarette smoke lingers the air.  In one corner there is a pool
table ready for a game.  Men are often lined up on the bar,
drinking their heads off.  Behind the bar are shelves filled with
all kinds of spirits.  A staircase leads upwards.
2848.name: Market Square Pub

description: This is a small circular room at the base of the southeast guard
tower.  Spiral stairs lead further up into the watchtower.  To the
north is the intersection of South and Coffin.
2903.name: Base of the southeast tower

description: You are at Park Road which continues north and south.
3131.name: Park Road

description: The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.
There is a long counter set against the gray, dungeon like wall
of the room.  Clem can normally be found behind the counter, ready
to sell his customers whatever they desire.  There is a small note
on the counter.
3380.name: Clem's Counter

description: You see the House of Fetish.
The smell of coffee fills this cozy establishment.  The Cafe is
small and quiet.  Round tables stand scattered around the main floor.
The walls are brick, featuring rows of book shelves filled with books.
To the west, a large bar stands, with several coffee makers behind it.
A spiraling staircase leads up to the roof.
2849.name: Market Square Coffee Cafe

description: The underground vault of the bank is as cool and quiet as a crypt. There
are rows upon rows of small compartments for holding the most precious of
jewels and other assorted valuables.  A set of stairs lead back up to the
bank lobby.
2868.name: Bank Vault

description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You are on Coffin Street.  To the east, the city wall opens up to
White Dragon Boulevard and the bad neighborhoods of Westbridge.  It
is a feared place with gangs and crime.  River Street leads off to
the west.
3104.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
South Street marks the southernmost edge of Westbridge.  The south
wall looms high overhead, helping to keep the city safe from invaders.
The street continues on to the west and east.
2838.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see South Street, Westbridge
You see South Street, Westbridge
The walls are marked with lots of scratches.  Some of them spell sentences
like "JAIL IS BETTER THAN SQL" and "BIGFOOTDAMOOSE IS ALIVE".
This is a dark and humid jail.  The dank stone walls are hard
and cold to the touch.  A heavy steel door is to the north.
3143.name: Jail

description: The Main Street of Westbridge runs north and south through town.  Gas
lamp lights line the street on either side.  To the west, a large window
looks in on the {RMarket Square Coffee Cafe{..  Some tables sit outside the
cafe.  The {RMarket Square Pub {xis to the east.
2889.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: The bar of swordsmen, once upon a time beautifully furnished.  But now the
furniture lays about the room in small pieces.  To the south is the yard, and
upstairs is the entrance hall.
3022.name: Bar of Swordsmen

description: You see the practice yard.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
Arsenal Street runs beside the western wall, just south of the West
Gate of Westbridge.  The road continues along the western wall in both
directions.  Just to the north it intersects with the Street Of Life.
A gatehouse is to the west.
3042.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 205 Arsenel Street, Westbridge

3000.name: {GImmortal Room {8- {BWa{bt{8e{wr{8d{be{Bep {YA{ydventure {BR{bun {CM{canagement{x

description: A small hallway here reveals two doors, one to the west and one to
the east.  The door to the west is labeled Sleeping Quarters.  The
door to the east is labeled Mess Room.  To the north is the main room
of the Station House.  The south wall is covered in pictures surrounding
a map of Westbridge.
3086.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CH{callway{*]{x

description: This is the Magical Experiments Laboratory.  Dark smoke-stained stones
arch over numerous huge oaken tables, most of these cluttered with strange-
looking pipes and flasks.  The floor is covered with half-erased pentagrams
and even weirder symbols, and a blackboard in a dark corner has only been
partially cleaned, some painful-looking letters faintly visible.  A well in
the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the
depths.
3019.name: Mage's Laboratory

description: You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and south along the wall.
3388.name: West trail around Westbridge

2885.name: Below The Ruins of the Casino

description: An old man putters around behind the counter, making strange love potions
and curative philtres.  He is eager to greet new patrons and relieve them
of their burdensome coins.  Judging from the furnishings, he's been made
very wealthy by his trade.
3056.name: Fountain of Youth Apothecary

description: You see the eastern end of Street.
An empathic wave of holy might radiates from the chamber.  Within,
rosemary is strung from the ceiling, bunched with assorted herbs.
Tomes of ancient lore litter the floor in an entropic pattern and
wisps of incense soothe all about with the sweet sent of jasmine.
Toward the center of the room, a ward of protection pulses in a
hypnotic rhythm.  Interwoven among the runes, the Dreaming brushes
this part of the world and leaves a feeling of tranquillity compared
to no other.  A silver plaque is mounted by the entrance of the
chapel.
2816.name: Beltaine's Chapel of Danu

description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Not much
can be seen from here since mountains block the view to the east.
A small river flows through an arch in the wall far below.  The wall
extends to the south.  To the north is an archway leading to the
eastern gatehouse.
2918.name: Atop the eastern wall

description: You see that this is truly delicious pastry.
The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water
and your soul sing.
| {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|
|               {wbut only if the shopkeeper deals in      {b|
|               {wthat kind of item.                       {b|
| {GVALUE {g<{citem{g> {g- {wthe shopkeeper will offer you a price   {b|
|                {wfor your item, if he is interested at   {b|
|                {wall.                                    {b|
| {YHELPFUL BUYING TIP:                                    {b|
| {WBUY #*<item> will buy multiples of the item, up to a   {b|
|  {Wlimit of 50 per transaction (example: buy 5*pie).     {b|
Here is the interior of a small bakery.  A sweet scent of danishes
and fine bread fills the room.  The items are all arranged in fine
order on the shelves and seem to be of the best quality.  A small
sign is on the counter.
3009.name: Tom's Bakery

description: You see Westbridge Way.
This tree-lined section of Arsenal Street continues beside the
Westbridge neighborhoods.  Although the neighborhoods are a more
recent development, all of the greenery looks well established.
2842.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
This is a small circular room within the northeast tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the west and south.
2914.name: In the northeast tower

description: | {WBuying items in a shop is easy. Here are some commands {b|
| {Wthat are useful:                                       {b|
| {GBUY {g<{citem{g>  {g- {wwill buy the item you specify, if the    {b|
|               {wshopkeeper offers it.                    {b|
| {GLIST        {g- {wshows you a list of what the shopkeeper  {b|
|               {wsells, along with item level and price   {b|
|               {w(in silver coins).                       {b|
| {GSELL {g<{citem{g> {g- {wwill sell an item in your inventory,     {b|
|               {wbut only if the shopkeeper deals in      {b|
|               {wthat kind of item.                       {b|
| {GVALUE {g<{citem{g> {g- {wthe shopkeeper will offer you a price   {b|
|                {wfor your item, if he is interested at   {b|
|                {wall.                                    {b|
| {YHELPFUL BUYING TIP:                                    {b|
| {WBUY 1. will buy the first item the shopkeeper sells.   {b|
|  {W(useful when you can't quite figure out what it is    {b|
|  {Wthe shopkeeper has. BUY 2., BUY 3., etc also works!)  {b|
This is a large, fully stocked General Store. The building looks
very new and has the smell of fresh supplies.  Shelves are stocked
full of goodies to take on adventures around the realms.  The
general store owner sells wares with a grin from ear to ear. A sign
hangs on the wall.
3010.name: General Store Of Westbridge

description: You see Westbridge Way.
This marks the intersection of two streets: Judge Street running east
and west and Emerald Avenue running north and south.  Several small
residences line both of the streets.  The houses are in various states
of upkeep but most look quite comfortable.
2854.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x and {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: These Are The Rules Of The Healing Wound Inn:
- NO FIGHTING
- DO NOT WAKE OTHER PEOPLE
- NO CANCELLING EACH OTHER (w/o permission), OR CASTING SPELLS OF WAR
People of all kinds can normally be found resting within this
large inn.  Most will sit around the healer, telling stories about
their last adventure. The owner of the inn, a former adventurer
himself, stands here giving and selling spells. A large featherbed
rests here, just big enough for two. There is a large sofa against
the east wall and a huge pool with bubbles that looks like ten men
could fit in it.  A {gsign{x hangs on the wall.
3008.name: Healing Wound Inn

description: You see the Temple Square.
This is the intersection of Main Street and the Street Of Life.  To the
north, a large temple can be seen with the north wall of Westbridge beyond.
A sign hangs on the corner indicating that a Pizza Parlor, an Auction House
and The Yawning Portal Inn are to the east.  A large set of stairs lead down
under the temple, and northward to the north gate.
3303.name: {BThe Intersection of {CMai{cn {B& {&L{*if{&e{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see The Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see The Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see stairs leading into a tunnel.
Main Street continues north and south through the city.  To the
west are several quaint apartment buildings set just behind a large
meeting hall.  It appears that they can be accessed through the street
that intersects just north of here.  To the east is an older building,
converted to ye olde convenience shoppe and quick tavern, better known
to the citizens of Westbridge as the {RQuick-Mark South{x.  It seems
deserted, though.
2818.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
This is the inner sanctum.  A picture of the mighty Life is hanging on
the wall, just above the altar which is set against the western wall.  A well
in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from
the depths.
3002.name: Cleric's Inner Sanctum

description: You see your favorite place, the bar of divination.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
A medium size table sits in the middle of the room, many chairs surrounding it.  The top of the table is covered
3087.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{ceeting {CR{coom{*]{x

description: A set of cold marble steps lead up to the small station house nestled
here in the south central part of Westbridge.  Behind the station
house, to the east is the dangerous neighborhood of Westbridge, home to
roaming gangs, outlaws and lawlessness.  Two large black doors lead
east into the station house of the Order of Judgment.  The globes on
the lights next to the door read "Police".
3083.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron {g[{C319 {RC{ro{*ff{ri{Rn {GS{gt.{g]{x

description: You are standing in the chard remains of the town hall. Burnt wooden chairs
still line the walls and a large burnt desk still sits in the middle of the
room.
3137.name: Waiting Room

description: It looks like some kind of office.
Two strong stone towers surround a heavy wooden gate set into the city
wall that is the south gate of Westbridge.  Main street leads north toward
the center of the city or south, out through the gate.  South Street runs
along the wall to the west and east.
3255.name: Inside South Gate of Westbridge

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see South Street, Westbridge
You see the southern gate.
Main Street runs north and south all the way through the city
of Westbridge.  Gas lamps line the side of the street on either
side.  The pavement is well worn from the regular flow of traffic.
2888.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: Here is Main Street of Westbridge between Temple Square and Market
Square.  Gas lamp lights line both sides of the street.  Market Square
is further to the south, and the Temple to the north.  The {CCleric's Guild{x
is located west and the {CDruid's Guild{x is located to the east.
3315.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 105 Main Street, Westbridge
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 104 Main Street, Westbridge
A sign hangs slightly askew above a deserted store.
{R|  {mThe {MW{mestbridge {CQ{Buick{CM{Bart{x "{YO{ypen {C24 {BHours {xA Day, {R7 {BDays{x A Week"  {R|{x
2909.name: Westbridge Quick-Mart

description: Coffin Street marks the eastern edge of Westbridge, following the
line of the eastern wall.  This section of road is less traveled,
given the lack of shops of buildings to enter.
2890.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: Arsenal Street runs north and south between the neighborhoods of
Westbridge to the west and the park to the east.  Large trees in
the park provide shade for the street and bushes grow over the low
fence surrounding the park.
2846.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
A slender tree grows right in the center of this room, its trunk
curved ever so slightly in an enticing way.  Upon closer inspection,
that tree isn't just a tree, it's a dryad!  An exit leads west back
to Main Street.  A small entrance to the bar is down a set of stairs.
3368.name: Entrance to Druid's Guild

description: You see Selduth Street.
Upon inspecting the rubble you notice a draft from below it...as if there's a passage underneath.
You are on a dusty trail following the outside wall of Westbridge.  To
the east the wall towers over you and to the west you see the forest of
Haon-Dor.  The trail leads north and stops abrubtly to the south due to
rubble and fallen logs.
3390.name: West trail around Westbridge

description: This is a small room, set off to the side of the Temple of Life.
A note on the wall states that this is a place to leave unwanted
items for other travelers.
3367.name: Donation Room

description: You see the southern end of the temple of Death.
South Street continues west along the southern wall of the city.
Here it intersects with the eastern perimeter street, called Coffin
Street, which runs along the slums of Westbridge.  To the east, South
Street ends at an alleyway where several vagrants and homeless loiter,
begging for change and generally causing trouble for the good citizens
of Westbridge.  Coffin Street leads north and to the south is the base
of the southeast guard tower.
3067.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: {x
Welcome to Waterdeep, the city seems to be missing at the moment, please try back later.
{x
Now leaving Waterdeep, thank you for coming, please come back again.
{x
3081.name: Waterdeep North

description: A small hallway extends north away from the lobby and diner.  On
either side is a door with a number on it.  The hallways ends here,
and a large window north looks out into the sky.  Room [3] is to the
west.  Room [4] is to the east.
3039.name: The Hallway

description: A small, tree lined path leads through the southern side of the
park.  A soft carpet of green grass lies to each side of the path
and there are several decorative statues to be admired.  A few
benches have been placed in shady spots, perfect for relaxing. To
the north is the edge of a small pond.
3113.name: Path in the Park

description: The entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen.  A place where one has to be
careful not to say something wrong (or right).  Down a set of stairs is the
bar and to the north is Westbridge Way.
3021.name: Entrance to the Guild of Swordsmen

description: You see Westbridge Way.
The Street of Life runs east and west here.  To the north is a
wall of the Healing Wound Inn but the door lies around the corner
on Main Street.  To the south sits a {RSmall Pizza Parlor{x, the smell
of pizza wafting out into the street.
3314.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
Coffin Street continues north and south.  To the east stand
an array of shoddy buildings separated by a large wall just next
to the street.  To the west is the {YTemple of Tempus{x.
2831.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
A small lobby opens up from the diner/bar to the south.  A small
desk stands to one side, with four boxes behind it.  A small desk
clerk sits behind the desk, going over some papers.  There is a small
round couch in the center of the room, but besides that, there isn't
anything else.
3037.name: The Westbridge Beacon Inn

description: You are at the southwest corner of the city wall.  The Concourse leads
both north and east, and a watchtower is to the south. To the west you
see the Temple Of Lanthander.
3127.name: On the Concourse

description: A walkway leads atop the southern wall of Westbridge.  Down below,
a road extends to the south through a dark forest.  Archways to the
east and west lead into city watchtowers.
2921.name: Atop the southern wall

description: {CCoffin Street{x and {CThe Street of Life{x meet at this corner.  To
the north is the famous {RWestbridge Inn{x where many adventurers find
a room for the evening.  An opening in the wall east of here grants
access to the base of the northeast tower and, through that, the
{RTrain Station{x.  The two streets lead west and south from here.
3266.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You are walking along Selduth Street, which extends along the inside of the western
wall of Westbridge.  To the south, you can see an intersection with a crowded
Clan street.  The northwestern corner of the city wall lies ahead to the
north.
3259.name: Selduth Street

description: To the south, Selduth Street intersects with a crowded Clan street.
This large room is more reminiscent of a dark dungeon than a shop.
Indescribable contraptions hang from the ceiling and walls, and the
floor is littered with ropes and leg cuffs.  To the east and west
are counters with sales clerks and to the north is a large brass
door.  A set of stairs lead up.
3378.name: House of Fetish

description: You see Nemesis' private dungeon.
You see Clem's counter.
You see something.
You see Mercy's counter.
You see the entrance hall.
The room, just faintly lit by torchs hanging in scones at both ends
of the room, appears to be a prison where the Paxians can lock up
criminals.  Large, steel cages line the walls, each locked up tightly.
Many of the cells are currently occupied by riffraff and thugs.  The
stale smell of urine and sour milk permeates the entire room, and only
the small gaps under the door offer any air to circulate throughout
the room.  There is a desk right by the door, with a bored looking
guard sitting behind it.  He is propping his head up with his hand,
and idly playing with some cards.
3068.name: {YPa{Wxi{Yan {WJa{wil{*h{wou{Wse{x

description: This is a small circular room within the southeast tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the north and west.
2920.name: In the southeast tower

description: Here is the middle of the Temple Square.  To the north, huge marble
steps lead up to the temple gate.  The entrance to a large cathedral
is to the west and {gThe Healing Wound Inn{x is just east of here.  A few
large cracks in the ground can be seen.
3005.name: {CTe{&mpl{ce S{&qua{Cre{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 103 Main Street, Westbridge
You see the air.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
This is a rustic-looking tavern, decorated liberally with stuffed bears,
wildcats, and various other vicious fauna.  The chairs here are crafted
from antlers and animal bone, and behind a massive bar made of roughly-
hewn oak stands a very tough looking bartender.  A small sign is hanging
on the wall.
3372.name: Ranger's Bar

description: You see the study.
Area [Blackstaff's Tower] Room [32356] --> Area [Waterdeep] Room [20940]
