Welcome to Waterdeep, the city seems to be missing at the moment, please try back later.
{x
Now leaving Waterdeep, thank you for coming, please come back again.
{x
3080.name: Waterdeep South

description: Judge Street continues west here and ends shortly to the east at
Coffin Street.  A few large, run-down buildings line the street on
either side.  It seems this area has been somewhat neglected.
2855.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: A dimly lit tunnel runs under Main Street and the Temple of
Life.  A bright light can be seen in the distance to the north
and there is a set of stairs leading up to the surface.
3265.name: Tunnel Under Main Street

description: You can see the northeast corner of the city wall.
{x
Commands to control the Grand Arena:
"close the ga" : Closes the Grand Arena, and stops it from loading.
"reset the ga" : Closes the Grand Arena, and allows it to run on its own.
"restart the ga" : Resets the Grand Arena, and Opens it immediately.
3219.name: Grand Arena Loading Room

description: You can see a rickety bridge to your northwest, leading back into
Central Westbridge.  A rustic dock connects the Diner with the Westbridge
River, and a boat or two floats lazily past.  Across the river you can see
the Levee and the Guild of Thieves, but they seem very far away from all
of this...
The smells of baking bread and simmering stew entice patrons through
the doorway of the diner.  No greasy spoons to be seen here-- the
booth walls are covered in casual paisleys; the chairs are carved wood,
rescued from garage sales.  Most tables have chess or backgammon boards
carved and painted on their fingertip-smooth tops.  The refrain of some
classic musical production blends with the dusty golden light and the
wonderful smells to put customers completely at ease.  A huge picture window
looks out over the Westbridge River, and a doorway leads down onto the dock
and the South Bank river landing, while the main entrance to the south
exits out to River Street.
On most days Kate can be found here, testing a batch of stew or brewing
a special pot of cinnamon coffee, eerily just in time for your arrival.
Pull up a chair, perhaps play a game, and take time out to talk.
3150.name: Kate's Diner

description: You see Austral Square.
You stand in a large yard here. Men and women all around are
screaming and fighting. These are people in training. A large
man stands in the middle of the yard, yelling commands.
3334.name: Training Yard

description: The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.
There is a long counter set against the gray, dungeon like wall
of the room.  Mercy can normally be found behind the counter, ready
to sell her customers whatever they desire.  There is a small note
on the counter.
3381.name: Mercy's Counter

description: You see the House of Fetish.
{*This {wfine{* establishment was constructed just west of the inner{x
{*northern{x {*gate of westbridge.  Behind the sturdy {yoak{* doors,this is a{x
{*place of rest,{x {*relaxation,and enjoyment for all who visit.  A polished{x
{yoak{* bar stretches{x {*along most of the back wall,a list of {Ydrinks{* has{x
{*been carved wonderfully{x {*wonderfully into the wood.  A plush leather{x
{bco{Bu{bch{* invites most who enter.  {x {*A {xpool {Gtable {* sits in the center of{x
{*the room inviting all to a game.  {x {*Towards the back corner rests a{x
{*fine looking booth,bearing a {Wsign {*reading{x {*"{RReserved.  {*" The {ybo{Yunc{yer{x
{*gives you a quick glance over upon entering,{x {*probably better not to{x
{*make him angry.{x
{*This {wfine{* establishment {*has been burned to the ground, smoldering{x
{*ruins {*of the bar and tables jut up out of the ground in various{x
{*places as the{x {*wrath of Nisstyre is well apparent.{x
3079.name: {YZ{yalan's {*B{wa{*r{x

description: Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the west you
can see the edge of a big forest. A small dusty trail leads north along the
wall.
3052.name: Outside West Gate of Westbridge

description: Alongside the western wall of the city, Arsenal Street runs
north and south, marking the western edge of Westbridge.  To
the west is the dangerous {YTemple of Cyric{x.  To the east lies
the terrifying Church of Nightmares.
3129.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You are on a road leading around the inner walls of Westbridge.  To the north,
the concourse heads towards a bridge into northern Westbridge.  To the south,
you can see an intersection with Elm Street.  The quaint paved streets of
Penny Lane lie west.
3272.name: On the Concourse at Penny Lane

description: You see Penny Lane.
The concourse continues south, towards an intersection with Elm Street.
The southernmost street of Westbridge, South Street, intersects
with Emerald Avenue here.  South Street runs west and east and
Emerald Avenue leads north.  To the west is the South Gate where
travelers enter and exit the city.
2836.name: {rS{Rout{rh {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see South Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
Main Street continues running north and south through the city. Here,
there is a mix of feelings.  On the west side side of the street there
is a bright, almost cheery disposition centering around a large meeting
hall with a sign that reads {RThe PaX Hall{x.  On the eastern side of the
street, it is almost as dark as night, with deep shadows looming about
the {YTemple of Shar{x.
2819.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You are in the park.  The paths lead north and east.  Eastwards is the
park entrance and to the west you see a small pond. To the south you
see the Temple Of Oghma.
3115.name: Path in the park

description: The entrance hall is a small modest room, reflecting the true
nature of the Clerics.  The exit leads east to the temple square.  A
short flight of stairs leads up to the cleric's bar loft area.
3004.name: Entrance to Cleric's Guild

description: You see the Temple Square.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
Arcane smells and a hint of incense in the air lend the feeling that this
isn't so much a bar as it is an apothecary.  A small sign is hanging on the
wall.
3369.name: Druid's Bar

description: This is a small room built into the city wall.  A mechanism for
lowering the siege door for the west gate is set into the wall, but
seems to be rust locked from years of neglect.  A small staircase
leads up to the top of the gatehouse.  Arsenal Street is to the east.
2901.name: Western gatehouse

description: Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
Just to the west are two small towers that have been built into the
city wall, connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.
Westbridge Way leads east and Arsenal Street leads both north and
south from here.
3040.name: Inside the West Gate of Westbridge

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
Main Street continues here beside the lovely park in Westbridge.
Several people walk along the lush green grass of the park.  Birds
chirp, the trees are full, and the grass is very green.  Various
wildlife wanders the park including ducks and squirrels.  Main
street leads north and south.
3108.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
This fine establishment is the Park Cafe, a very well lighted, cosy
place.  The cafe is built from large logs and resembles a rustic cabin.
The park can be seen through the windows in the northern wall, along
with the duck pond.  Through the southern window there is a view of
the comings and goings on the street.
3106.name: Park Cafe

description: This is the eastern end of the Street Of Life, nearing Coffin Street.
To the west can be found Tony's Pizza, The Yawning Portal Inn, and
eventually Main Street.  To the east, the eastern wall of Westbridge
looms in the distance.
2822.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You are between two small towers that have been built into the city
wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To
the east the plains stretch out in the distance.  Westbridge way leads
west from here.
2892.name: Under the East Gate of Westbridge

description: This is the inside of a small building.  All around is a large room
with a few scattered tables.  A large counter sits to the left.  To
the unobservant this may appear to be a bar, yet it is a special place.
The crowd within don't bother to look at newcomers, they simply continue
their quiet conversations with their customers, sitting at the tables.
This is the store known as {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{Wun{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{x.
2862.name: {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{&un{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{B [Station]{x

description: You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.
3392.name: Crudely dug Tunnel

You stand inside the top story of the Pub.  Here you see a large
room, basically the size of the whole building.  The walls are covered
in draps of diffrent colors, and religious symbols hang from the wall.
The room has no furniture, only pillows on the floor, where you see
some lushes woman and men sitting, looking towards the master, Quija.
Quija sits above all the rest, meditating, and watching over his
followers.  A servant sits next to him, holding a small tray of
drinks.  A sign stands next to Quija, which reads "AREA QUESTS" on the
top.  You see the staircase going downwards.
3359.name: The Quest Master's Chambers

description: The stairs lead back down to the pub.
This is Westbridge Way.  To the north is the {Rweapon shop{x and to the
south is the {CWarriors Guild{x.  To the east the road leads out of town
and to the west can be found Market Square.
3016.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 508 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 509 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
The Main Street of Westbridge transitions here to a dirt path just
outside the strong wooden gate on the southern walls of the city.
Guards eye all travelers suspiciously from the two towers on either
side of the gate as they stand watch to protect the city from the
goblins of the forest beyond.  A smaller dirt path branches to the
west, heading to the {RNew Adventurer's Shop {xand New Beginnings.
3256.name: Outside South Gate of Westbridge

description: You see the southern gate.
{wYou see a {RN{YE{rW{w direction off in the west.
The green forests of the Miden'nir are south, hiding countless goblin warriors.
The Street Of Death continues its way through western Westbridge.  The
{RLeather Shop {xsits to the north.  There is a very large and colorful building
with a large sign on the south side.  The sign reads "{BC{ba{Cs{Bi{bn{Co {RN{Gi{Yg{Mh{Rt{Gs{x".
3044.name: {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 602 Street Of Death, Westbridge
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the west, the green
canopy of the Haon Dor forest stretches off into the distance.  To
the south, a city is barely visible beyond the Miden'nir forest.
Spiral stairs lead down into the tower.
2929.name: Top of the southwest tower

description: You step into a large booth. A large table sits in the middle of the
booth. The red booth seat curls around the table, holding many people
to sit here. To the south is an opening with a curtain on it.
3387.name: Small Booth

description: This is Westbridge Way, a great place for shops.  Nearby, to the
west are the large heavy gates of the western entrance of Westbridge.
Market Square lies further east.  To the north, a large building stands,
reading {RT{rri{RP{rower{x {*Bo{Wun{*ty {RHu{rnte{Rrs{x.  South of here is the entrance to the
{CMages Guild{x.
2812.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 500 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 501 Westbridge Way, Westbridge
Judge and Coffin Street intersect here, with Judge Street
running west and Coffin Street north and south.  To the east
rises an impressive station house, set in brightly polished
ivory with two large doors.  Enforcers belonging to the Order
of Judgment regularly enter and exit the building.
2830.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
Westbridge Way continues its way along the west-east path it takes.
To the east loon the large east gates of Westbridge.  To the west are
the shops of Westbridge Way, a good place to shop.  To the north is
the {CWe{Bstbrid{Cge Qu{Bi{Cck-M{Bar{Ct{x.  To the south is large open building
with a sign that reads '{RWestbridge Courier Check Point{x'.
2813.name: {CW{cestbridge {CW{cay{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
You see Westbridge Way, Westbridge.
You are standing at the eastern end of the park.  A small path leads west
into the park.  Going east through the entrance you will reach Emerald
Avenue.
3116.name: Eastern Park Entrance

description: Bunk beds fill up most of the room u, with the exception of a little
space to walk in between and footlockers at the end of each row.  This
is the daily living quarters of the law enforcers.  One shift sleeps
while the other patrols the city.  These quarters remain quiet except
during the shift change.
3089.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CS{cleeping {CQ{cuarters{*]{x

description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
A sturdy stone bridge allows Arsenal Street to cross the river.  The
bridge is built out from the western city wall and the river flows west
through an opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.  To the east,
beside the river, is an odd looking building painted bright orange with
purple trim... it appears to be the {RMob Factory{x.
3047.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet {CB{cr{&id{cg{Ce{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
A large cathedral stands here, with steps leading up to a pair of
ornate doors.  Organ music can be heard filtering out through the
doors; some upbeat, some eerie.  The scent of both well oiled and
burnt wood is in the air.
2859.name: Steps of the Church

description: A room atop one of the city watchtowers.  To the north, a wall of
mountains rise up out of the plains.  The north sea is just visible
through a break in the mountains.  Far to the east, it's possible to
just make out the spires of another city.  Spiral stairs lead down
into the tower.
2927.name: Top of the northeast tower

description: The Great Stone Bridge Of Westbridge.  The original wooden one was
destroyed by the famous Ragnarok that still lingers somewhere overhead.
While crossing the bridge, it is easy to notice the fine stone work that
makes its construction.  The bridge stretches over the River Of Westbridge,
which flows into various caverns and, rumors tells it, all the way to the
Sands Of Sorrow.  Newly created "Makou Gas Lights" lead across the bridge,
casting a greenish light over the water.  The Crier Square of Westbridge
stands to the north.  A short distance to the south is the great green Park
of Westbridge.
3395.name: {BThe {WG{*reat {WS{*tone {WB{*ridge {Bof {WWe{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You are at a bend on Park Road.  To the south the road goes on and to the
west is the Road Crossing.
3136.name: Park Road

description: Arsenal Street continues north and south along the western wall.
The barren faces of brick walled buildings line the eastern street,
some marked with grafitti.
3071.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: Emerald Street continues running north and south through Westbridge.
A short distance to the south, it intersects with Judge Street.  A
large open building lies to the west with a sign hanging above the
walkway that reads "{RFirst National Bank of Westbridge{x".
3119.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: The smell of grease, oil and makou fuel is heavy in the air, a
stench so great that no one except someone without a nose could
resist.  The repair shop was dug out from underneath Westbridge in the
side of the riverbank, the bank that is now kept at bay from the large
stone walls that make up Airship Park.  The entire building is filled
with airship parts, engines, iron hull plates, and tools which lie
around on the ground.  The floor is covered with oils and grease, the
cause of the stench.
{x  Type HULL HELP to learn how to repair your own airship.
3075.name: {CP{cor{Ct {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Re{cpa{Cir S{cho{Cp {&({YP{yx{YF{&){x

description: {B
| {WTo convert platinum to gold, or gold to silver, drop   {b|
| {Wone more piece than what you have.                     {b|
| {GExample{g: {wyou have 5 platinum, 8 gold, and need more    {b|
| {wgold to change your alignment. Simply drop 9 gold on   {b|
| {wthe ground, and you will then have 99 gold--enough for {b|
| {wthe priest's services!                                 {b|
The altar appears to have been carved from a single piece of obsidian.
Dark red stains cover it's surface.
Death's hateful gaze can be felt within the confines of this small
chapel dedicated to the force of Death.  The walls are covered in a
layer of black slime and the purest of evil seems to be radiating from
a large black altar in the center of the room.
3361.name: In Death's Chapel

description: You see a small foyer.
This is a small circular room within the northwest tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the east and south.
2912.name: In the northwest tower

description: The Street of Life runs east and west through Westbridge.  The walls
of buildings line either side, though there are no entrances here to
gain access inside.  The street continues in both directions.
3302.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: Street of Life continues east.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
{x
{x  To the north the river wall opens up to allow a single airship
into the structure.  A sign above the boathouse doors reads "The
Westbridge Airship Repair Shop".  Another opening to the south
is the tunnel to the Westbridge Cargo Courier Port.
3201.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: South Street ends here, next to a dangerous-looking run down
neighborhood.  You can enter the slums to the east, or head towards
the better part of town back to the west.  It occurs to you that this
isn't the happiest section of town.
3144.name: {RUNUSED{x

description: This is the park area of Judge Street.  The walk through the park
lies north, accented by lush green grass and wide, empty lots on
both sides of the road.  South and west of here can be found the
western neighborhoods of Westbridge, better known as the nice part
of town.   Judge Street continues west and east.
2858.name: {RJ{rudg{Re {GS{gtreet{x

description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the north, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the south.
2925.name: Western gatehouse

description: This is the Street Of Life, east of Main Street.  To the north
is the entrance to a popular Westbridge establishment, {RThe Yawning
Portal Inn{x.  To the south is the shadowy gated entrance to the
{CVampire's Guild{x.
3316.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
This is the eastern end of River Street.  Coffin Street lies just to
the east where it runs alongside the eastern wall of the city.  To
the north are some old shop buildings, now shuttered, while to the south
are dilapidated buildings and several vacant lots that are littered in
trash.  This part of town seems to have been neglected and could use
some renovation.
2825.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: You are standing in the entrance hall of the Yawning Portal Inn.  The hall
has been wisely decorated with simple but functional furniture.  A small
staircase leads up to the defunct reception room, and down into the dark.
The bar is to the east.
3006.name: Entrance to the Yawning Portal Inn

description: You see the Inn.
You see Street of Life
{x
{Y                          @    {x
{x
{x
{Y                          @    {x
{x
{x
{Y                          @    {x
{x
d
{x

{x
Walls made entirely of marble surround the room, with massive
pillars running parallel to the main entrance.  Opposite the door is
the Bar, where the judge is sitting, waiting to hear the cases before
him.  Engraved into the wall behind the bar is a warhammer with a a
scale perched on top of it, this is the holy symbol of Tyr, God of
Justice.  This is the hallway the Paxians use to judge the prisoners,
putting them before one of the Church of Justice for review and a fair
and just trial.
2865.name: The Hall of {WJu{ws{*t{wi{Wce{x

description: Construction is in progress for a Westbridge City Hall.  There
is scaffolding against the walls and workers regularly come and
go with various building materials.
3125.name: Westbridge City Hall

description: You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.
3391.name: Crudely dug Tunnel

description: You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar, just like the wall.
The road continues north and south next to the western city wall, which
towers overhead.  North of here is a bridge across the river.  To the east
is the {YTemple of Silvanus{x where the sounds of nature can be heard.
3051.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
{b|                          {RP{Yaid {RA{Ydventures!                          {b|
| {cTo open a run at random, say "{Copen random run{c".  This will attempt {b|
| {cto open a currently closed run at random.  You will only be charged{b|
| {cthe 15 AP if a run is successfully opened in this way.  Note that  {b|
| {csometimes it can fail.                                             {b|
| {cTo open a specific run, say "{Copen <run name>{c".  For a run that is  {b|
| {ccurrently closed, this service costs 30 AP.  To open a run that has{b|
| {cbeen completed costs 300.  There is no warning in the costs, you   {b|
| {cwill simply be charged the correct amount.  No refunds will be     {b|
| {cgiven for not following directions.                                {b|
| {cthe run names for this service are as follows.                     {b|
| {Cmoonshae, hellfire, deeper, iwd, kelvin, blackstaff, ckc, despair  {b|
| {Cteilmon, tchazzar, good and evil.                                  {b|
| {cTo see a list of the "Mini Runs" that do not show on the claim     {b|
| {clist that are open, say "{Cavailable events{c".  If none are open      {b|
| {cLoxar will not respond.                                            {b|
This room is full of grisly trophies of various sorts of monsters.  A large
dragon head with maw open exends from the wall above a large wooden counter
set in the west end of the shop.  Paintings and tapestries depicting the
killings of many infamous monsters.  A grizzled old warrior bristling with
weapons rests with his feet up behind the counter.
3224.name: {RA{Ydventures {RU{Ynlimited{x

description: Although a bit dusty the Coat of Arms is an excellent piece of work.
This is the Office of the Captain of the Guard, stationed right
beside the jail.  The Westbridge Coat of Arms is hanging on the
north wall and a heavy steel door is set in the west wall.  There
are almost always several cityguards here and they don't care for
intrusions.
3142.name: Captain's Office

description: You see the Cityguard Head Quarters.
River Street runs east and west, following the river that cuts
through the city just north of here.  The back part of some stables
can be seen on the north side whereas on the south side of the street
a low fence blocks off the lush city park.
2823.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
The small doorway opens to a stairwell that leads down into
a much cooler room.  The faint scent of incense wafts on the
air, bringing with it an aura of complete and utter peace
and calm.  The stone steps radiate their own coolness, and
the center of each stair shows a well-worn path down into
the depths.
3221.name: Small Stairwell House

description: The street leads north and south in the shadow of the eastern city wall.
To the east, the {YTemple of Mystra {xcrackles with arcane energy.  To the west
is the {RDragon's Hoard Emporium{x, a popular spot for business transactions.
3062.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: This is the western end of the Street of Life before it meets
Arsenal Street.  To the north is the entrance to the strangely
popular {RHouse of Fetish{x.  South of here can be seen the {YTemple{x
{Yof Celestia{x.
2821.name: {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
This room is full of staves along the walls, all well used and
worn smooth by years of being handled.  Candles line the floor
along the walls, setting a soft glow and light heat to swirl
about the room.  Incense burns in a couple of strategically
placed spots between the candles.  In the center is a large
cushion for the guildmaster to sit and meditate and guide fellow
monks on their path.
3222.name: Monk's Meditation Chamber

description: This is a walkway atop the eastern wall of Westbridge.  Swampland
extends to the west.  The wall continues to the north.  To the south,
an archway leads into one of the city watchtowers.
2923.name: Atop the western wall

description: This is a small circular room within the southwest tower.  Spiral
stairs lead both up to the top of the watchtower and down to street
level.  Archways lead outside to the north and west.
2922.name: In the southwest tower

description: The well traveled path of Main Street leads north and south.  To the
west is a large temple, dedicated to healing those who are in need.
The temple's patrons are healed by magical powers, given out by different
mages.  To the east stands the {RFirst National Bank Of Westbridge{x, ready
for all financial transactions.
2814.name: {BThe {RB{rank {Y& {RC{rhapel {Bof {CMai{cn Street{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 112 Main Street, Westbridge
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 110 Main Street, Westbridge
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
A small wooden dock extends out onto the Westbridge River, providing
a perfect spot for Kate's customers to arrive by boat.  The gentle
waters lap against the pilings of the dock.  Across the river can be
seen the boat launch for Dick's Warehouse of Boats.
3074.name: Below Kate's Diner

description: This is the southern end of Main Street, just before it reaches
South Street and the south gate of Westbridge.  To the west is an
imposing building constructed of large marble blocks, the Cityguard
Headquarters.  Within lies the city jail.  The street continues to
the north and south.
2820.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: You see Main Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
This small room is filled with the sweet smells of cedar and warmth
from a fireplace that is burning hickory.  The fire provides the only
light here and a small bush is set close to it.  The bush is recognizable
as a rare witchwood bush, the most magical of hardwoods.  A well in the
middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from its
depths.
3373.name: Ranger's Study

description: You see the bar.
You can't see what is down there, it is too dark.  Looks like it would be
impossible to climb back up.
This is the southern end of the Westbridge park.  Lush grasses carpet
the ground and there are many different flowering bushes and trees growing
in well arranged locations.  A small, tree lined path winds its way lazily
around the park.  It also branches south, where it widens to become Park
Road.
3126.name: Southern Park Entrance

description: The walls of this hall, made completely of marble, tower over even
the tallest man, stretching high into the air.  Massive, smooth marble
pillars line the walls, supporting the ceiling high above.  Between
each pillar, a tapestry is hung depicting each of the clans that makes
up the PaX.
2863.name: The {YP{Wa{YX{x Hall

description: The sign reads:
Use 'List' to see the available pets.
Use 'Buy <pet> <name>' to buy yourself a pet and name it.
You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around.
If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master.
If you have several pets you may use 'order all <instructions>'
Regards,
The Shopkeeper
The Pet Shop is a small crowded store, full of cages and animals of
various sorts and sizes.  There is a sign on the wall.
3031.name: Pet Shop Boy's Pet Shop

description: This is the intersection of Arsenal and River Street.  Arsenal continues
north, against the western wall of the city, and south, by the southwest
part of town better known as the Westbridge Neighborhoods-- "a nice place
to live".  River Street begins to the east, following near the river all
the way to the eastern part of town.  The city wall stops abruptly here
and veers far to the west, shaded slightly different in the stones which
are still rough from fresh cuts.  It appears as if the city was expanded
not too long ago to make room for the growing neighborhood.  To the west
begins the Street of Silences in the neighborhood of Westbridge.
3100.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
A large room opens up with a massive oak desk in the center.  The
desk sits almost level with a human's head, making those who approach
it look upward.  The top of the desk is hidden behind iron bars, keeping
those who sit behind it safe from possible attacks.  To either side,
chairs line the half plaster and oak paneled walls.  There is a large
door to the south.  To the east is another door, only made from iron
bars.
3084.name: {*[{RO{7O{&J{*] {CWe{&st{7br{&id{Cge {RSt{rati{Ron{x {*[{CM{cain {CR{coom{*]{x

description: You are on a small path running through the park.  It continues west and
south and just north of here you see the southern wall of Park Cafe.
To the north you see The Temple Of Cyric.
3109.name: Small path in the park

description: This part of Main Street is halfway between Market Square to the
north and Festival Square to the south.  The brick buildings on either
side of the street stand three stories tall and have an old fashioned
look to them.  To the east is the {RJeweller's Shop{x, where one can find
gems at affordable prices.
2810.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: Arsenal Street meets the usually crowded Street of Life which is
filled with shops and artisans.  The Street of Life stretches off to
the east, toward the far wall of the city.  Arsenal leads away to the
south  To the west is the base of the northwest tower of Westbridge.
3258.name: {YAr{Ws{*e{Wn{Yal {GS{gtreet{x and {RSt{rreet of Li{Rfe{x

description: You see Street Of Life, Westbridge.
Penny Lane is a quiet, tree-lined street.  The lane is narrow and
does not appear to see much traffic.  Emerald Avenue can be found
to the west and Penny Lane continues around a bend to the north.
3139.name: Penny Lane

description: This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.
2910.name: Western gatehouse

description: Arsenal Street runs beside the western wall, just north of the West
Gate of Westbridge.  The road continues along the western wall in both
directions.  Just to the south it intersects with the Street Of Life.
A gatehouse is to the west.
3257.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 203 Arsenel Street, Westbridge
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
| {WBanking here on Waterdeep is simple! Here are some     {b|
| {Wuseful commands to know:                               {b|
| {GDEPOSIT {g<{camount{g>  {g- {wwill deposit the amount and the    {b|
|  {Wtype of coin specified (example: deposit 1 silver)    {b|
| {GWITHDRAW {g<{camount{g> {g- {wwithdraws the specified amount     {b|
|  {Wfrom your account and appears on you.                 {b|
| {GBALANCE           {g- {wshows you your current balance     {b|
| {YHELPFUL BANKING TIPS:                                  {b|
| {WCarrying around lots of money means hauling around     {b|
| {Wlots of coins on Waterdeep, which will contribute to   {b|
| {Wyour overall weight. Take advantage of banks and       {b|
| {Wdeposit your extra money every now and then--there is  {b|
| {WNO penalty for using them!                             {b|
| {WIf you find you have a lot of gold or silver on you,   {b|
| {Wsimply give 1 <coin> self to have it converted!        {b|
Welcome to the First National Bank of the Tri-Power State.  To either
side of the room, the walls are lined with guards armed to the teeth.
There are several tellers behind a large wall, protected by iron bars.
The Bank was once powered by Westbridge itself, but now rules under the
government.  Tables line the walls for people to write on.  There are
exits to the west and east.
2815.name: First National Bank Of Westbridge

description: The sign points in all directions:
North - Emerald Avenue.
East  - Park Road.
South - Emerald Avenue.
West  - Park Road.
Someone had added something with red paint, but it's been crossed out.
Tall buildings rise up on either side as Emerald Avenue continues
through the southeastern quadrant of Westbridge.  To the east is
the {YTemple of Lathander{x which seems to reflect the rays of the
morning sun.
3120.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: The Street of Death ends into Coffin Street here beside the eastern
wall of Westbridge.  To the west can be found several shops and other
buildings.  Somewhere to the south there is the sound of water.
3251.name: {*C{Wo{Rff{Wi{*n {GS{gtreet{x and {YSt{Rree{*t of D{Rea{Yth{x

description: You see Street Of Death, Westbridge.
You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
This part of the pub is filled with dancing and singing.  A
wandering minstrel is on a chair in a corner with his lute.  A busty
red headed woman is standing near him and singing a tale of comedic
heroism.  Drunk men sit laughing at their tables and busy bar maids
weave through the crowd with full mugs and horns of ale and mead.
Another part of the pub is located to your west.  The bar is to the
north.  A set of steps occupy in a corner of the room.  They lead up
to the Questmaster's Chambers.
3356.name: Room in the Pub

description: A set of stairs leads up to the reception area.
You have entered into a cold, dark, and moist man-made tunnel.  By the
looks of the walls of dirt it seems that this was done quite recently.  Up
ahead are the sounds of rushing water.
3393.name: Crudely dug Tunnel

description: The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
The bar is one of the finest in the land, lucky it is members only.  Fine
furniture is set all around the room.  A small sign is hanging on the wall.
3003.name: Cleric's Bar

description: You see the inner sanctum.
The Promenade marks where Main Street meets River Street.  The river
can be heard flowing gently north of this street which runs alongside
it.  A large stone bridge crosses the river to the north toward Crier
Square.  River Street leads east, to the Westbridge Pawn Shop and
Kate's Diner, and west to the Stables.
3102.name: {BThe {RPr{romena{Rde{B of {CMai{cn Street{x

description: You see Ocean Street, Westbridge.
You see Main Street, Westbridge.
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn.
Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender.
List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and
specialties, and tell the price of each.
Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer,
poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.
You are standing in one of the greatest bars in Westbridge.
Here there is alot of room for people to sit and relax.A
fireplace with a pair of chairs sits on the eastern wall.
The bar is to the north with a tall skinny bartender behind
it.
A small sign with big letters is fastened to the bar.
3007.name: Yawning Portal Inn

description: The Entrance To The Inn.
Emerald Avenue continues on its north and south path through
Westbridge.  To the north, the street intersects with Judge
Street.  To the south, the street continues on to the southern
wall of the city.
3133.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: This room is lined with shelving and bins filled with bits and
pieces of curiosities.  Armor and weapon racks hold an assortment of
ornate pieces throughout the shop.  Against the west wall is a large
polished wooden counter behind which sits a lovely young woman leafing
through an old book.  On the counter is a book titled "Aurora's whole
realm catalogue".
3223.name: {8A{mu{Mro{mra{x'{8s {CE{Bm{bp{cor{bi{Bu{Cm{x

description: A gate swings lazily upon rusty hinges, creaking from countless
centuries of use.  Just beyond the gate, burning red eyes can be seen
and a ghostly white hand beckons for entry.  Unintelligible whispers
seem to linger in the air asking unknown questions. A stairway leads
underground.
3374.name: Entrance to Vampire's Guild

description: {x
{W
{W
{W
{x
{x
{W
{W
{W
{x
{x
{W
{W
{W
{x
{x
{W
{W
{W
{x
This is the grand Hall of Glory, the final passage on the way to the
Hall of Judgement.  The hallway is lined with tapestries depicting the
great victories of the Pax Faerunis against the darkness of the realms.
The aura of this hallway is breath taking, radiating with the goodness
and light that makes up all those who are in the Pax and all the powerful
warriors who call themselves Paxians.  A large engraving of a harp is
carved high up on the ceiling.  The seal of the Harpers is here, keeping
the balance of the world.
2864.name: The Hall of {CG{cl{Co{cr{Cy{x

description: The note reads:
List  - Show which various items are in the store.
Buy   - Buy an item.
Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
pay for your item.
Sell  - Sell an item.
Break - You break it, you bought it.
This is the inside the Gord's Weapon Palace. The walls are covered from
top to bottom with weapons of all kinds.  Gord stands here, smiling, waiting
for customers to buy something or to break something.
3011.name: Gord's Weapons Palace

description: You see Westbridge Way.

This place stands one of the greatest points in the realms, Market
Square.  Market Square is the center point for the city of Westbridge,
and also known to be the center point of the Western Great Realms.
This area features a huge cobblestone square, crowned with a fountain
and statue in the middle.  Park benches line the outer edges,
allowing people to rest.  The center fountain stands tall, a statue in
the middle of Nisstyre Bloodstoner with water flowing around the base.
Several streets lead off different directions.  Going east and west
from the square is {BWestbridge Way{x, a main route between the
major cities.  To the west can be found the Bounty Hunters Office,
Bakery and other shops.  To the east can be found The Quick-Mart and
General Store.  Going north and south is {BMain Street{x of Westbridge.
{WThe Healing Wound {WInn{x, and {WQuestmasters Office{x is north, the {WPark{x and
{WBank South{x.  A large sign hangs in the corner of the square, pointing
out the different shops.
3014.name: {CMa{Wrke{ct S{Wqua{Cre{x

description: Arsenal Street leads north and south through western Westbridge.
What used to be the western edge of the city has been expanded to
make room for the neighborhoods of Westbridge.  Just to the south
is an intersection beside the southern wall.
2841.name: {YAr{&s{*e{&n{Yal {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
You see Arsenal Street, Westbridge.
A small hallway extends north away from the lobby and diner.  On
either side is a door with a number on it.  Room [1] is to the west.
Room [2] is to the east.
3038.name: The Hallway

description: You are on Penny Lane.  The narrow road continues north and west, and
the concourse intersects this street to the east.
3140.name: Penny Lane

description: You see the concourse.
The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.
3205.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: The iron bars are broken, allowing passage through the hole in the wall.
Beyond the bars you see a dark tunnel.
bars
This small tunnel leads under Main Street and the Temple of
Life, granting underground access to Westbridge.  A bright lamp
illuminates a stairway that leads up to the dusty road just
outside of the North Gate of Westbridge and the plains beyond.
3268.name: Tunnel Under the North Gate

description: You see the north gate of Westbridge.
Boxes and crates, oh my! This is Westbridge's Major Warehouse
where citizens store their things.  It is a giant building with
nothing but cages, boxes and crates.  A janitor walks around
sweeping the dirt off the floor.  Some boxes are stacked almost
like stairs, leading up into darkness.
3050.name: Warehouse

description: You see the Street.
You see machine dreams and taste violet phosphor.
This long room is over the eastern gates of Westbridge.  Remnants from
a less peaceful past dominate this room, from the heavy iron door waiting
to be dropped in place over the gate below, to the archers slots in the
east wall and ambush holes in the floor.  A small set of stairs lead down
to street level.  The gatehouse extends to the south, and a doorway leads
out on the wall to the north.
2917.name: Eastern gatehouse

description: This is a small circular room in the base of the northwest tower.
A set of spiral stairs lead further up into the tower.  There is a
heavy iron door set into the north wall.  It looks like there used
to be a door in the south wall but it has since been bricked up.
2907.name: Base of the northwest tower

description: This is the northern end of Emerald Avenue.  To the north, the
avenue ends where it intersects with River Street, just across
from Kate's Diner.  Modest sized buildings line the street on
both sides as Emerald Avenue continues north and south.
3132.name: {CE{cm{Mer{ca{Cld {GAv{gen{Gue{x

description: Welcome to The PIT, the lowest and cheapest place to drink.  The
bar's walls are totaly empty because every picture that was hung here
has been smashed over someone's head.  A sign on the wall reads 'Nightly
Fights'.  Fortunately there are some tables and stools left for sitting.
3048.name: PIT

description: This vast, hangar-like building is the Westbridge Courier Offices
checkpoint.  To the north, airships and people alike can pass through
to Westbridge Way.  To the south is parking for airships and the offices
proper.
3064.name: Westbridge Courier Check Point

description: You are on Elm street.  Park Road is to the west and Elm Street continues
in eastward direction.
3123.name: Elm Street

description: Inside the large flying structure you find a large lounge type
area.  A large bar stands at the northern end, with a kitchen behind
it.  Hot food is coming in and out to the small tables spread in the
middle of the floor.  To one side you see a few couches and a healing
area.  More or less it looks like an Airship Roadside Diner.  A small
list of BOUNTIES hang on the western wall.
2869.name: {R[{G- {-The Westbridge Beacon {G-{R]{x

description: Coffin Street extends north and south along the eastern walls of the
city.  The wall casts its looming shadow across the street in the early
hours of the day, shortening with the passing of the sun.  A gatehouse
is to the east.
3250.name: {*C{&o{Rff{&i{*n {GS{gtreet{x

description: You see Coffin Street, Westbridge.
[{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 309 Coffin Street, Westbridge
North of here stretches the Great Stone Bridge of Westbridge.  The
river of Westbridge laps at the banks below, carrying boat traffic up
and down the river.  Airships can be seen floating to the east in the
Airship Park along the river.  South of here is the recently renovated
Southern Westbridge.
3069.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: This is Main Street, Westbridge, one of the most well traveled
thoroughfares in all the realms.  The pavement is well worn by many
years of traffic.  Gas lamp lights line either side of the street.
3254.name: {CMai{cn Str{Weet We{cstbri{Cdge{x

description: North of here you see Crier Square.  The river flows from east to
west.  The riverbanks are too steep to climb.  A bridge passes
overhead, connecting Westbridge to the promenade.  A large stone
walkway runs under the bridge and airships are allowed to tie up here
under the bridge.  On one side of the river a large barrels of fuel
stand.
{x  To the north built into the river wall and under the bridge stands
Phil's Bar, a popular hang out amounst airship pilots and adventurers.
3202.name: {CWe{cstbrid{Cge's {YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{x

2879.name: The Southern End Of The Wreckage

description: You are on River Street.  To the south are the long walls of various
buildings.  To the north is a a large building featuring a prominent
that reads "{RWestbridge Pawn Shop{x".  Through the windows of the pawn
shop can be seen all matter of trash and treasure.
2826.name: {CR{Bive{Cr {GS{gtreet{x

description: [{RT{Bri{RP{Bower {GS{gtate {RP{rost {CO{cffice {MA{mddress{x]: 705 River Street, Westbridge
A large tunnel goes underneath Westbridge to the Cargo Courier,
located at the end of the tunnel.  To the north the tunnel opens up
into the Westbridge River, a large iron gate on either side sits
against the wall open.
3092.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x

description: A large tunnel big enough for an airship runs north and south, to
the south it leads to the Westbridge Cargo Courier.
3093.name: Underground Passage to the {CWe{cstbrid{Cge Co{curi{Cer{x

description: Only a gate separates this training yard from the Street of Life
to the north.  To the south is a small building that looks only
large enough to house a stairwell that leads down.  This yard
is littered with splinters from spent staves as well as the
remains of many a straw man rent asunder.
3220.name: Entrance to the Monk's Guild

description: This chest is firmly locked, and the device by which it opens is beyond your
reckoning.
A faint smell of incense lingers in the air within this room.  A soft
bearskin rug lays upon the floor, muffling footsteps.  A simple bed lies
against the far wall.  At the foot of it is a sturdy ironbound chest, most
likely full of Melancholy's trappings from her adventuring days.  On a small
table under a window to the east is a vase with a single white rose.  Other
than that, the room is quite bare.
3161.name: Melancholy's Room

description:
THOUSANDS OF YEARS AGO, before the dawn of man as we knew him,
there was Sir Santa of Claus, an ape-like creature making crude and
pointless toys out of dinobones and his own waste, hurling them at
chimp-like creatures with crinkled hands regardless of how they
behaved the previous year.  These so-called "toys" were buried as
witches, and defecated upon, and hurled at predators when wakened by
the searing grunts of children.  It wasn't a holly jolly Christmas
that year.  For many were killed.  A war-like race of elves from the
Red Planet landed on the ice-encased Earth, and they were immediately
enslaved by the unevolved Santa Ape to make his confused toys using
galactic elfin technology.  Toys were made into recognizable shapes
and given names like "train," but these toys were also thrown at
predators and defecated upon because they were so stupid.  Christmas
still sucked, in a big way.

Meatwad: Boy, this IS a long story. Maybe I WILL get something to eat.

Carl: Yeah, I think I'm gonna get drunk while I listen.

Frylock: So, about this blood...

Robot: Let's just wait for them. ...So you been in the neighborhood long, or...

Frylock: Well, I mean we moved here, next to Carl--

Robot: THOUSANDS OF YEARS AGO the ice had made the globe invariable.
Santa Ape did not know where the North Pole was. How could he? He was
born before science existed. So he arbitrarily placed his workshop
RIGHT HERE, long before they unionized, and Christmas was celebrated
at each full Moon in front of a great red ape--

description:
{C
Runpurger is a mob holding rather complicated mprogs related to the systematic
opening, closing and resetting of Waterdeep's adventure run areas.  The basic
premise of the mprogs is as follows:
{W
Mprog Sequence Starts (MUD Crashes/reboots or runpurger is loaded up)
  1. Countdown mprog does initial check
     - closes all runs
  2. Countdown mprog cycles through base 32 checks
     One run is selected to be opened
     Run is open at next check
  3. Countdown mprog resets/recycles another base 32 checks
     Another run is selected to be opened, regardless if previous runs are done.
  4. Countdown cycles through the opening of every run
     The system resets itself by closing all runs and restarting the countdown.
{C
It is quite common for the mprogs to get "stuck" whereby it no longer counts
down.  This is evident by the lack of any new "run counter" items in runpurger's
inventory (the same items will remain there for a long period of time).  Consult
posted instructions for information on kickstarting the system or utilizing any
of the other features (opening of individual runs, purging of all runs, stopping
any single run from opening).
{x
Dugmaren, 2007{x
2995.name: runpurger~
